I may be wrong, but I think that the purpose of XLink is to describe
relations (links) between resources, I mean existing resources, and thuth
retreived with a GET. I don't think it can be used to describe how to
interact with these resources. But may be this is the purpose of RDF and I
misunderstood XLink ...

----- Original Message -----
From: "Jan Algermissen" <algermissen@...>


> Is there a way something like this
> could be used with/added to XLink to be understood be every software
> that supports XLink?
>
> Other thoughts?
>
>
> Jan
>
